result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.      ** Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  Submit to a DNA sample, if not previously submitted. 
**Pay $250.00 DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:36pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions - consecutive to revocation in 10CF1109.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  No restitution requested.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:59pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest; found guilty by the court.  DE requests the court proceed w/o a PSI - denied.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. William Michel. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Zapf.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-5-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.

207pm
  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 1/30/14 @ 830am  Atty Bennett moves to dismiss complaint.  Court denies motion.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*No Contact w/property located at 1809 44th St.  *No discussion of this case with Kevin D B
